channel.title: Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) on Sandberg GPR
channel.description: Recent content in Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) on Sandberg GPR

item.title: Ensuring a successful GPR survey
item.description: Five things to ensure a successful GPR survey. An experienced GPR surveyor using the correct equipment and methods is key to a successful…

item.title: Chimney Flue Location
item.description: Google description is called summary.

item.title: What can Ground Penetrating Radar be used for?
item.description: Find out how GPR works? What’s it for? Can it help you? In this article, we make a business case for Ground Penetrating Radar in the construction industry.

item.title: GPR bridge investigation
item.description: On bridges GPR can be used to map reinforcement, locate post-tensioned tendons, determine general construction detail, thickness of construction and much more…

item.title: Floor slab utility survey in a working office
item.description: How we used GPR for a floor slab utility survey in a working London office to locate services with minimal disruption to the office staff.

item.title: Construction and building defects in a London school
item.description: We used GPR to investigate construction detail and identify building defects, specifically if precast hollow core units had reinforcement within them and were filled with concrete.

item.title: Gas holder base thickness measurement
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR survey methods to determine the gas holder base thickness non-intrusively, with access to one side only.

item.title: Paddington train station platform survey
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR survey methods for a station platform survey and concourse area investigation at Paddington Station.

item.title: St Helen’s church – survey to locate voids in stone walls
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR to locate voids in stone walls up to 1m thick, comprising a stone inner and outer leaf, with a rubble fill.

item.title: Warehouse tendon location survey with on-site mark-up
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR tendon location survey methods for floor slab tendon location with in situ mark-up in a working warehouse.

item.title: Wellington monument investigation
item.description: GPR case study: How we used GPR to investigate the construction detail and understand this unique and somewhat complex Grade II listed monument.

item.title: Pad foundation location survey
item.description: How we used GPR to locate and map pad foundations, including construction detail, on a site in Waterloo.

item.title: Concrete Floor Slab Surveys
item.description: Our GPR surveys provide a fast and efficient NDT means of surveying concrete floor slabs to determine construction detail and identify defects.

item.title: Locate Services in Slabs
item.description: Non-intrusive surveys to locate services in floor slabs. We find the services for you so that you can drill and undertake intrusive works safely.

item.title: Locating embedded metal in masonry
item.description: Our NDT GPR surveys can locate embedded metal in masonry, including structural frames, fixing cramps and pins. Ideal for listed and heritage buildings.

item.title: Locating post-tensioned tendons in concrete
item.description: Our NDT GPR surveys can locate tendons, including their depth, in pre-stressed and post-tensioned concrete. Essential prior to cutting, coring or drilling.

item.title: Locating underfloor heating pipes
item.description: Our GPR surveys provide a fast and efficient NDT means of locating underfloor heating pipes. Works for metal and plastic. Locate before you cut or drill!

item.title: Concrete reinforcing bar location and other site mark-up surveys
item.description: Non-destructive concrete reinforcing bar location surveys using GPR. If you need a simple rebar location, we can mark up rebar positions on site.

item.title: Rebar mapping and concrete imaging surveys
item.description: High-resolution GPR rebar mapping, reinforcing steel location and concrete imaging surveys to depths of 400mm. Superior resolution to other methods.

item.title: Retaining wall surveys
item.description: Our non-intrusive GPR surveys can determine retaining wall construction detail, thickness and identify defects. Access is only required to one side.

item.title: Slab thickness measurement surveys
item.description: Non-intrusive surveys to provide slab thickness readings for concrete slabs, screed layers, bridge decks, road construction and more. Only one-sided access required.

item.title: Wall Thickness
item.description: Need to determine wall thickness or party wall detail but only have access to one side? We can help. Our GPR surveys can determine wall thickness, wall construction and more….

item.title: Void detection and location
item.description: Our GPR surveys can detect voids beneath slabs. By scanning on a regular orthogonal grid, the void location and extent can be determined and plotted.

item.title: About Sandberg
item.description: Sandberg GPR is part of Sandberg LLP, an independent private, professional partnership founded in 1860 providing consultancy and independent professional services.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: This Privacy Notice describes how Sandberg LLP collects and uses personal data. It applies to existing clients, prospective client’s website visitors and Sandberg suppliers.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Contact details for the Sandberg Ground Penetrating Radar department based at Clapham, London.

item.title: Ground Penetrating Radar and how it works
item.description: Ground Penetrating Radar detects changes in the sub-surface. Find out how GPR works, what it can detect, how deep it can penetrate and its advantages.

item.title: Gpr Equipment
item.description: A Ground Penetrating Radar system comprises two main components: a control unit and an antenna. But what are the differences? Which is best?

item.title: Ground Penetrating Radar FAQ
item.description: Find answers to questions we are commonly asked about GPR in our Ground Penetrating Radar FAQ. What is GPR? What can it detect?

item.title: Sinkhole detection
item.description: GPR is an excellent non-intrusive survey technique for sinkhole detection and location. We typically use a dual-frequency GPR system…

item.title: Pile cap location survey
item.description: Need to locate pile caps? Sandberg can undertake non-intrusive pile cap location surveys and determine slab thickness and reinforcement distribution.

item.title: Construction Detail Verification
item.description: Using GPR to verify construction detail and compliance with current legislation and standards. Suitable for floor slabs, concrete and masonry walls…

item.title: Why you must locate reinforcing steel in concrete before you drill
item.description: “Locate concrete reinforcing steel before you find it with your drill bit, core barrel or saw! Work safe and avoid dangerous and costly hits”.

item.title: Concrete Scanning
item.description: Concrete scanning covers a range of techniques to establish detail within concrete including rebar location, mapping and imaging, thickness and tendons.

item.title: Chimney flue surveys – looking back
item.description: Sandberg was one of the first to start using GPR for chimney flue location. In this article, we look back at how it started and how things have changed.

item.title: Embedded steel in historic buildings
item.description: Detecting embedded metal in masonry walls non-intrusively. Ideal for historic and heritage buildings.

item.title: Filler joist location in floor slabs
item.description: GPR is very effective in detecting and locating filler joist locations in slabs and can even differentiate between dense reinforcement and filler joists.

item.title: Floor slab survey for load capacity
item.description: How we used GPR to provide information for the back-analysis of a warehouse floor slab, including slab thickness, reinforcement and location of piles.

item.title: Concrete inspection – locating hazards and defects in concrete
item.description: GPR concrete inspection enables you to see into the sub-surface to determine construction detail, locate dangers, and identify defects in concrete.

item.title: Chimney flue location in thick stone walls
item.description: How we detected chimney flues and other voids within a stone wall construction over 1 m thick.

item.title: Euro Gpr membership
item.description: Our current Euro GPR Certificate of Membership confirming Sandberg membership.

item.title: Restoration of Buildings – how GPR can help
item.description: GPR is an NDT method which can help in building restoration projects by determining construction detail and thickness, locating voids and embedded metal and much more.

item.title: GPR finite difference time domain modelling
item.description: An article about fibite difference time domain modelling of precast concrete units, written by our Davide Campo has been published and is now available.

item.title: JP Morgan Corporate Challenge
item.description: On Thursday 5 July 2018, Sandberg took part in the 42nd J.P. Morgan Corporate Challenge at Battersea Park, London.
